IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: See Schedule O.Can'd Aid spreads people powered dogoodery through Towns, Tunes, Treads and Trails, and Love Yur Mama efforts nationwide.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Can'd Aid spreads people powered dogoodery through Towns, Tunes, Treads and Trails, and Love Yur Mama efforts nationwide.
IRS990.Desc: Water and Response - Works to respond quickly and passionately to help people recover and rebuild in the wake of disasters. Through our Water and Response program, we partner with other companies to can, ship and distribute clean drinking water to communities in need post-disaster. We have responded to 64 natural disasters and shipped 3.1 million cans of water since our inception.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Music and Arts - Through our Music and Arts program, we work to eliminate barriers and provide access to music, arts and culture. Can'd Aid works with nationally touring musicians (Tunes ambassadors), and provides hands-on music workshops for underserved youth and have donated more than 3,000 instruments to Title 1 public school music programs in need across the country. We also provide small grants to emerging artists to help support them in their careers.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Treads and Trails - This program is focused on decreasing screentime and promoting active and healthy lifestyles for underserved youth. Volunteers have built and helped donate over 16,000 bikes, skateboards and helmets for youth across the U.S.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Recycling and Sustainability and Other Programs - From helping launch sustainable recycling programs to spearheading river, beach and trail clean-ups, Can'd Aid works to support sustainability initiatives across the country. Our recycling program, the Crush it Crusade, provides organizations, parks, municipalities and schools with training and resources needed to launch their own sustainable recycling programs. We also lead volunteer-driven river restoration efforts, tree planting and trail maintenance projects.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization is exempt from federal income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and is classified as other than a private foundation. The organization follows FASB ASC 740 Income Taxes, which requires entities to determine whether a tax position is more likely than not to be sustained upon examination by the applicable taxing authority. The organization has evaluated tax positions taken related to its tax-exempt status, and none are considered to be uncertain. Therefore, no amounts have been recognized as of December 31, 2022.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Georgia Interfaith Power and Light (Morningside Congregation)
Rose Tree Park - Pennsylvania Resources Council

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grant Monitoring Policy In accordance with this policy, Can'd Aid commits to managing all grants received (in-kind or cash) and regardless of amount in the following ways: 1. Purpose In accordance with United States law, all Can'd Aid received grant funds, and income earned on those funds, will be spent as specified in the grant agreement. Grant funds will only be used for such purposes as outlined by the funding agency and in accordance with the budget submitted with the grant proposal. All grant implementations will align with the foundation's funding guidelines. Any substantial changes from the approved budget will be approved in writing with the foundation prior to implementation. 2. Reporting All Can'd Aid received grant funds will comply with specified grant reporting duties and obligations as outlined by the funding entity. These reports will be submitted by the specified deadline. 2A. Narrative Reporting As such, Can'd Aid commits to tracking, compiling and sharing all necessary narrative reports. This may include but is not limited to detailing what was accomplished by the grant, a description of the progress made toward achieving the goals of the grant and an assurance that the activities under the grant have been conducted in conformity with the terms of the grant. 2B. Financial Reporting Can'd Aid commits to tracking, compiling and sharing all financial statements, in U.S. dollars, as outlined in the grant agreement. This includes all expenditures of grant funds during the grant term. The grant purposes will be charged against the grant, and records will be maintained of such expenditures, allowing Can'd Aid to adequately communicate the use of such fundaids. Any unused funds will be reported and explained as required per the grant agreement. 3. Prohibited Activities In accordance with the the tax laws of the United States, Can'd Aid understands that grant funds received may not be used for any of the following purposes: A. To carry on propaganda, or otherwise to attempt to influence any legislation (within the meaning of Section 4945(d)(1) of the United States Internal Revenue Code); B. To influence the outcome of any specific public election or to carry on, directly or indirectly, any voter registration drive (within the meaning of Section 4945(d)(2) of the United States Internal Revenue Code); C. To make grants to individuals for travel, study or other similar purposes by such individuals (such as scholarships, fellowships or grants for research), unless such grants satisfy the requirements of Section 4945(g) of the IRC; D. To make any grant to any other organization (other than to public charities or exempt operating foundations) which does not comply with the requirements of Section 4945(d)(4) of the United States Internal Revenue Code; or E. To undertake any activity for any purpose other than the charitable purposes specified in Section 170(c)(2)(B) of the United States Internal Revenue Code.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Can'd Aid makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The organization has not changed its oversight or selection process during the year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: 990 Parts I,III,VII,IX,XI; Sch A-Part II; Sch C-Part II; Sch D-XI, Sch I-II
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: This 990 was amended to report the balances per the final audited financial statements on the Statement of Functional Expenses and the Reconciliation of Net Assets. The program service accomplishment descriptions and amounts were also updated, along with public support reporting, the compensation of officers, the reconciliation of income per the 990 to the audited financial statements, and the grants and other assistance given to other organizations.
